alert.note: Alert for Ellis; Lane; Ness; Rush; Scott; Trego (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 01 at 12:18PM CST until January 02 at 11:00AM CST by NWS Dodge City
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 11 AM CST SUNDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...For the winter weather advisory additional snow accumulations of up to an inch this afternoon. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 20 below zero. * WHERE...Trego, Ellis, Ness and Rush Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter weather advisory, until 6 PM CST this evening. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from midnight tonight to 11 AM CST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause primarily travel difficulties. Be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities...and use caution while driving. A Wind Chill Advisory means that very cold air and strong winds will combine to generate low wind chills. This will result in frost bite and lead to hypothermia if precautions are not taken. If you must venture outdoors...make sure you wear a hat and gloves.

area.areaDesc: Ellis; Lane; Ness; Rush; Scott; Trego
